messages.title: Putting money back in your pocket
messages.content: Nick Clegg's Lib Dems will make the first £10,000 tax-free. This gives everyone a £700 tax cut and takes millions out of tax for good. Pensioners would be taken out of paying income tax by closing tax loopholes exploited by the very rich, taxes on pollution and by a new 'mansion tax'.

messages.title: OUR NHS: At risk with the Conservatives
messages.content: Tory Health spokesman accepted £21,000 donation from private health firm boss. David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners. Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase the tax-free personal allowance to £10,000, giving everyone a £700 tax cut and lifting millions out of tax payment obligations altogether.
Pensioners will receive a larger tax cut of £100 with every working couple benefiting from a £700 tax cut.
Close tax loopholes exploited by the very rich, impose taxes on pollution, and introduce a new 'mansion tax' for real change in Britain.
Highlighting the risk to the NHS under Conservative policies based on past actions and statements by Conservative representatives.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A recent poll showed Tory voters couldn't decide who was best to steer us out of Britain's economic crisis.

issues.economy: Fair taxes for real change in Britain. The Liberal Democrats will introduce various taxation measures that contribute to economic fairness.
issues.environment: Taxes on pollution are part of the proposed measures for a fairer tax system.
issues.governance: Closing tax loopholes and ensuring the wealthy pay their fair share contributes to better governance.
issues.health: The NHS is at risk with the Conservatives; the Liberal Democrats highlight past actions by Conservative representatives that suggest pro-privatisation stances.

housing.content: The Liberal Democrats propose a 'mansion tax' which is a 1% levy on the value of homes worth more than £2m.

quotes.text: A recent poll showed Tory voters couldn't decide who was best to steer us out of Britain's economic crisis.

images.caption: Lib Dem Shadow Chancellor Vince Cable with local Parliamentary Candidate David Lee.
